title: Mia Chloe
author: Mia Chloe
content: Hi I am new to Bitcointalk and crypto how do I be of significance to the forum and Bitcoin community as a whole.I

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: First welcome to the forum!Here is a Bitcointalk forum a place were all bitcoin discussion are being carried out, including other altcoin relate topics. First as a newbie I would advise you not to desperately venture into bitcoin investment rather devote time to read all information about bitcoin which I know this forum is large enough for you to read wider range of information concerning bitcoin progression and the latest happening.Then before going further I would love you to read this thread carefully https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: First welcome to the forum... It's good to have you here. First you should try exploring around the forum and see things for your self, use the search button on the forum when ever you want to ask few questions or seeking some explaination, their might already be existing threads regarding those issues. Check the threads below if you are the type that love reading it will help you alot.  Newbies - Read before posting  [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?  : [General] How to earn Bitcoins Although they are all pinned on the welcome page of this board, I guess you were not able to identify them useful.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk. To be significant on the forum you first need to know how it works. Read the forum rules and other important threads, you will find them stickied to the top of different boards starting with this one. Those threads important pointers for the forum take your time to go through them. As long as you keep to the rules and don't spam you're already better than majority of registered users.To last long here remember two important rules;• No plagiarism,• No sharing of malwares.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Welcome to the forum.Do a lot more reading and watching videos. Most of the information you might want to seek is actually readily available. All you need to do is make full use of the forum search button or even search engines.What you do not understand, you can ask in the forum.As time goes by and as you accumulate more knowledge, you will be able to engage in discussions and even help out other fellow members.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Adding to what others have said, just keep your heads down and be natural be your self like you will be in the real world... No word spinning, if you have good intentions of coming here, you will pass through the forum and the forum will also pass through you.. what I mean is that you will have alot to learn from the forum and the forum members will also benefit from you from the little that you can contribute in any way (knowledge and skill)

comments.author: israt1@
comments.body: You are welcome. As a newbie, try to see and understand the rules first. You must understand it and find the search option if you want to know something. When you don't find it, create a topic. Of course it is in the specified place.

comments.author: Adams0001
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum and you are at the right place to learn more about bitcoin and cryptocurrency. First of all, you should understand the forum rules to avoid being punished for violating any of the forum’s rules. Take time to research yourself around the forums different boards to understand the type of discussions there. And always ask questions when you don’t understand, they’re many people here that can give solutions to your questions. After that, you can join in discussions and bring solutions to questions asked or enlighten the forum about anything that’ll be helpful to them. With that, you’ve started contributing to the forum. Best of luck in the forum.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Welcome here to the forum, everything that you wanted to know is here in this section.  Spend your precious time reading all pinned topics on each section and start here, because that is very important to know before you'll start here, those guidelines and regulations that most users know.  It seems like choosing a platform, we should always read the terms before using it to avoid violation in the future and that's the same on this forum. Best of luck and see you around.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on May 30, 2023, 09:34:24 PMHi I am new to Bitcointalk and crypto how do I be of significance to the forum and Bitcoin community as a whole.IMaybe best to read first the rules set by forum administrator and second try to do more efforts you needed in this forum so that you can contribute relevant of post or threads that can help other fellow forum member here.Also don't over expect on anything especially on potential earnings we can get here. Focus to learn since earning follow and its really rewarding especially if you have both learnings and earnings. Lastly join many forum activities since this could help you increase your visibility and maybe that can help you to get some merits and rank up according to your target rank to reach.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Hello! Welcome to the forum! You signing up is already significant enough. It means another individual has taken the initiative to try to understand Bitcoin. I am seeing it this way. Since you're a newbie both to the forum and to Bitcoin, it isn't expected from you to share deep knowledge on Bitcoin. You are here to gain some. I guess it is enough for you to enjoy exploring the forum, read enriching discussions, and perhaps raise some clarificatory questions later.

comments.author: wd1
comments.body: Hello, welcome to community! If you decide to buy any bitcoin (or any other crypto generally) please keep these things in mind related to security:1- The general consensus of the bitcoin community is that self custody of your coins is much better than keeping them on any centralized exchange or platform.2- Always backup your seed phrase offline, and never ever share it with anyone.3- Be diligent about scams, don't listen to people who reach out to you via DMs pretending to 'help' you.Again, just be careful and diligent and it can be a fun ride!

comments.author: Patrol69
comments.body: First off, welcome to the BitcoinTalk forum. As you are a new member of the forum, you may be wondering how can I know about all the topics in this forum.  In the initial stage everyone is new but regular active in the forum already gets an idea about the forum. There are certain rules of the forum, you should read those rules carefully first. After knowing the rules well you will observe the various sections. Separate sections are open for each subject try to get ideas from different sections. If you don't understand something, you can create a topic about it. Always try to avoid off topic posts.

comments.author: ITExpert
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on May 30, 2023, 09:34:24 PMHi, I am new to Bitcointalk and crypto how do I be of significance to the forum and Bitcoin community as a whole.IHi, I am also a Newbie but before joining this platform I have some research on Bitcoin talk platform and how it works and are benefits of joining. I ask questions from Google and youtube which helps me a lot because Bitcoin is the Future so we are prepared for the future but I am also in a learning phase

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: You can't really contribute much if you're new in the first place — probably besides asking good questions that'll make even the experienced users think. (not those questions that have been asked time and time again and is easily Google-able).

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. You can't really be of significant to the forum when you have little or zero knowledge about the forum and cryptocurrency so I will advise and encourage you to do well to read more of the questions that has been asked before by other newbies so you will not repeat the questions again because there you can get a whole lot of good answer which has been provided by other forum users. Do well to also read about the forum rules so that you don't end up going against it, goodluck and welcome once again.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on May 30, 2023, 09:34:24 PMHi I am new to Bitcointalk and crypto how do I be of significance to the forum and Bitcoin community as a whole.IThat is an interesting question from a newbie. OP, why would you want to be significant? Why do you think the forum needs it? I have always assumed that people come here to make the platform a meaningful place for them, and not otherwise. Do you really think that for several years of existence, the forum needs it?Change your thinking. Explore the forum, do not go out of your way to achieve significance. Your talent, if any, will show itself.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on May 30, 2023, 09:34:24 PMHi I am new to Bitcointalk and crypto how do I be of significance to the forum and Bitcoin community as a whole.IYou should take time to observe how the forum works. Apart from studying the rules of the forum, there are some unwritten rules that you will learn through experience. You will learn these rules through close observation of how members interact with each other and the culture of the forum. The forum has different sections that are filled with important information. Spend time to read through these sections of the forum and you will identify areas that interest you more. Research on that section and be proficient in that area but it will be good to also have a sound general knowledge about bitcoin. Ensure you also avoid using ChatGPT or other AI tools to do your post. Your post needs to be original and if you copied it from somewhere ensure they are referenced accordingly. If you are here to learn about Bitcoin, you find this place extremely valuable. You are welcome to the forum.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: The best contribution from your side can be that you focus on learning first of all as you are totally new to to crypto space before sharing anything.There are many knowledgeable and helpful threads on forum to guide you about different aspects like wallets ,keys and other things that will help you to get idea about how it works and let you participate in effective discussion.Just be original in your ideas and you will get things slowly so never be in a hurry as it will teach you lot of things.There are some links yo thread on which you can read about forum rules and treat it as discussion forum where you can get knowledge and exchange it with others.If you have any doubt feel free to ask and if you can then just go through  Mastering Bitcoin  book that will help you a lot especially first two chapters being non developer.
